intro: Paepalanthus hydra, commonly known as the water hydra, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and wetlands. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
